titles.title: Expressing the sense of the Congress in support of Dr. Ibrahim Rugova, President of the Republic of Kosova.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Europe and the Middle East.

bill.summary: 3/16/1993--Introduced. Expresses the sense of the Congress that: (1) the U.S. Government should ensure that the government in Belgrade discontinues and does not escalate "ethnic cleansing" in Kosovo; (2) the repression by such government of Kosovo's citizens must be halted immediately and individuals whose employment was terminated on the basis of ethnicity should be reinstated to their previous positions; (3) the educational system in Kosovo should be reopened to all residents and the majority ethnic Albanian population should be allowed to be educated in their native tongue; and (4) President Rugova's (of the Kosovo Republic) Ten Point Plan for Peace should be fully implemented.
